fieldsOfStudy: Liberal Arts and Sciences, General Studies and Humanities

headline: Deportation Officer with Immigration and Customs Enforcement
summary:
Over 8 years of military experience filling a multitude of management/leadership roles with a reputation for meeting the most challenging organizational goals and objectives. Over 3 years of experience in Imagery Analysis and Collection Management. A proven and VERIFIABLE record for:

â¢	Currently holds active Top Secret/SCI Clearance.
â¢	Known for the ability to build rapport and communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
â¢	Possesses strong background in national and theater collection platform capabilities, collection management planning, synchronization, execution, and assessment.
â¢	Proficient in the following programs: Web Fish Tools, National Exploitation System, CRATE, Google Earth, planning tool for resource, integration, synchronization, and management (PRISM), Web-based Access Retrieval Prototype (WARP), NATO Intelligence Toolbox, and Microsoft Office Suite.
â¢	Appointed as a key point of contact for all theater/national requirements including electro-optical (EO), infrared (IR), measurement and signatures intelligence (MASINT), ground/dismounted moving target indicator (G/DMTI), light detection and radar (LIDAR), multi-spectral imagery (MSI) requirements, and all other geospatial intelligence (GEOINT) requirements to process, validate, and disseminate to all perspective commands/organizations.
â¢	Assisted in multiple collection strategies to support the U.S. Marine and United Kingdom troops in Counter-IED, Counter-HME, and other combat operations.
â¢	Communicated with higher, adjacent and subordinate commands/organizationsâ Collection and Requirements Managers including entities to answer intelligence related requests for information (RFI) and de-conflict or collaborate collection strategies between areas of operation (AO).

positions.description: Deployed to RCSW, Afghanistan in support of OEF as an ISR Collections Chief managing over 150 various requirements, assisting RCSW subordinate units with collection strategies, and providing/coordinating training of the different ISR assets and the capabilities/limitations of the ISR effects possible.
positions.title: Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance Collections Chief

positions.description: Processed and analyzed imagery gathered by various sensor platforms to derive information needed to fill commanders RFIs. Derived intelligence from imagery in support of updating military intelligence databases at national, theater, and organic level. Produced products including Battle Damage Assessments (BDA), Order of Battle (OOB), Lines of Communication (LOC) surveys, Helicopter Landing Zones (HLZ), coastal landing beach surveys, and target raids.
positions.title: Imagery Analyst

positions.description: Assisted in the advising of Marine Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Squadron 1 (VMU-1) battalion commander and section officers in coordinating intelligence operations. Responsible for over 12 Intelligence and Imagery Analysts and the discipline and welfare of those Marines including evaluating intelligence, assessing the operational situation, and ensuring the unitâs clearances were accurately recorded. Accountable to the battalion commander for the on-the-job (OJT) training of newly appointed Imagery Analysts waiting to attend their professional MOS school.
positions.title: S-2 Intelligence Chief

positions.description: Instructed over 80 Marines in basic military training, fundamentals of Marine Corps Leadership, policies and procedures, Marine Corps Martial Arts Program (MCMAP) training, and administrative correspondence procedures. Responsible for the accountability, discipline, and professional development of 15 Marines and 5 Non-Commissioned Officers (NCO). Supervised personnel readiness, maintenance, and utilization of technical publications to properly conduct all troubleshooting procedures in response to maintenance requests. Ensured the appropriate quality control (QC) methods were conducted and all administrative forms were properly filed prior to release of equipment.
positions.title: Platoon Sergeant / Command Training Representative

positions.description: Well-versed in the preventative maintenance and repair of over 400 pieces of equipment including small arms missiles systems, ground ordnance laser and night vision devices, and other fire control equipment. Performed mechanical, mechanical-optical, electrical, and sight synchronization procedures to include inspecting, troubleshooting, and the calibrating of fire control equipment and systems. Supervised/coordinated the administration and training of multiple iterations of USMC Reservists in their respective military occupational specialty (MOS) training in accordance with all technical publications.
positions.title: Electro-Optical Ordnance Repairer
